title: SrF+ equil. - K is smaller at high temperature

content.question:
Sr2+(aq) + F-(aq) ⇄ SrF+(aq)
At 25°C, the equilibrium constant for the reaction represented above has a value of 1.3. At 50°C, the value of the equilibrium constant is less than 1.3. Based on this information, which of the following must be correct?

choices.label: The reaction rate decreases as the temperature is increased.
At 25°C, ∆G° for the reaction is positive.
At 25°C, ∆S° for the reaction is positive.
At 25°C, ∆H° for the reaction is negative.

content.answer: At 25°C, ∆H° for the reaction is negative.

topic.text: 9.3: Gibbs Free Energy and Thermodynamic Favorability

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
